intro: Tiaridium indicum, commonly known as the Indian tiaridium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat, disc-like structure, which is typical of the Asteraceae family. Tiaridium indicum is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of wetland flora.
